this is the first half life game that i have completed, and i reccomend this one above all the other ones in the half life one timeline. you play as a security guard known as barney calhoun and experience your side of the black mesa incident surviving aliens and us military forces at the same time trying to save the scientists from certain death. and in my reviews i give these games a max of 13, so for nowadays sake id give it around a 10, maybe 11 out of 13 due to how old the graphics are.

Recently played through Blue Shift, and it was pretty good. It's pretty short and it doesn't really give you much that's different from the original Half Life (no new weapons or enemies), but the core gameplay is still great and the different perspective is cool.
It's no Opposing Force, obviously, but still a fun time.

За тривалістю ця гра дуже коротка, ти тільки звик до гри, а вона вже скінчилася і ти такий (невже все?). Як розширення всесвіту та розкриття персонажів, не погано.

I like this game. Many people take a large crap on it because it doesn't really introduce anything new, but it is so old and priced so low, there is no point not to pick it up.

The gameplay is slightly worse Half Life 1. So slightly that you might not even notice it. The story is a little lackluster, but I welcome any new lore to the HL franchise.

The gameplay is GOOD, damn it. It is FUN. 

Definitely cop this if you're an HL fan, If not, pick it up anyway.

I can't understand how they made a game like Half-Life in 1999-2000. Although I played the game the first time, I was satisfied. I don't talk about just Blue Shift. Normal Half Lİfe is also perfect. Watching the main scenes from the first game from different characters is a very good idea. The game time isn't long, so you can play the game fluently and comfortably. The previous game characters are reflected well in this game. Thanks to this game, we can understand Black Mesa incidents better.

In this game you play as a security guard named Calhoun, a character that is not mentioned that much in the first games but plays a huge role in half life 2. The Blue Shift shows you how Calhoun and some other scientists escaped from Black Mesa and some other details about the plot of Half Life. If you played Half Life 2 and got confused on who was that guy that helped Gordon when he arrived at City 17 (without giving any spoilers) thats probably because you didn't play this game before Half Life 2.
I recommend this game to anyone who likes the Half Life games and wants to know more about some of the characters you will meet in the future games.

Half-Life: Blue Shift to krótsze rozszerzenie niż Opposing Force który opowiada o koledzy Freemana i strażnika Black Mesy krótki dodatek ale tak samo jak Opposing Force warto go kupić i nie będą to zmarnowane pieniądze owsem nie ma tu takiej zabawy jak w podstawce i opposing force ale i tak warto zagrać.

It's just like half-life, but it's a bit short and not very memorable. It doesn't really bring anything new in, and hardly and sort of story. It was still fun to play if you want just a little more out of half-life, but I can't really recommend paying full price for it. If it comes down to having to choose between blue shift and opposing force, get opposing force, it is much better.
Not a review, just a recommendation.

This game in my opinion is really s**t, atleast if you compare it to Half Life: Opposing Force and original Half Life.It almost doesnt have anything new.

No new npcs except new unique scientist called Dr. Rosenberg (That appeared in this game and Half Life: Decay), technically slightly different looking scientists and I think 3 appearances of Otis.

No new weapons...and guess what.... it even has less weapons than original Half Life.

The hazard course is almost the same just like the one in original Half Life except with some minor changes.

If you care about multiplayer forget it.......but......but...forget it no multiplayer in this expansion pack compared to Opposing Force.

 The only real NEW thing is that f*****g HD pack which is not only ugly (imo) but they changed the pistol (from glock 17/18 into berreta m9/92FS) and submachine gun (from mp5a3/mp5sd3 [depending on w,p or v model] to m4a1/Colt 727......which is f*****g weird, also they both share the same ammo even the tho are technically different weapons with different AMMO!) which I dont get, some models look alright.

Maybe youre gonna like it if you play Blue Shift first and then Opposing Force...maybe, if youre like me and you played Opposing Force first then Blue Shift its gonna be inferior and will suck..

Do I recommend it ? F**K no....unless you really love Half Life then buy it. I didnt liked this at all and I hope that Guard Duty is gonna improve it (if it ever comes out). Half Life: Blue Shift more like Half Game: Blue S**t

I think im retarded i can't get past this one puzzle but its a half life game so its probably good.

To be honest I'd rate this as a maybe. If you're trying to experience all HL games like I am then sure go for it. But if you enjoyed HL and think this will be as good then you'll probably be upset. While it does feature a lot of elements from HL such as physics puzzles, winding corridors, and military ambushes it lacks in story as 90% of it is just Barney trying to escape Black Mesa with a detour of going into Xen. It does also feature a lot of bugs, one you'll probably run into is when the game refuses to load when going down the elevator to pick up the power cell. There are also some broken scripted events here and there but they can be fixed by just reloading your game.

If you are looking for a good expansion to Half Life then I recommend Opposing Force. If you still want to give this a try then I'd say wait until it goes on sale because I picked this and Opposing Force up for 50 cents each.

I love it

Никаких изменений в геймплее и геймдизайне. Ноль разнообразия по сравнению с оригиналом. Малая продолжительность и почти никаких ответов на вопросы. В какой-то степени разочаровывающий финал.
Как отдельная игра:
Не успевает надоесть из-за малой продолжительности, очень подвижная и динамичная. Интереснейшие головоломки.
Шикарная графика для года выпуска, физика сделана добротно, продуманный сюжет.
Увлекательный гемплей: Калхан, благодаря своей подготовки в Мезе, имеет прекрасные боевые навыки. Он умеет обращаться со всеми видами оружия и ловко прыгает и бегает. Естественно всем этим мы будем пользоваться. Как обычно разбиваем ящики для добычи ништяков, исследуем все закоулки, за что игра щедро нас вознаграждает.
Итог: Фанаты халв лайфа (как я) посмотрят дополнение и будут радоваться каждому проведенному часу, но если посмотреть объективно, далеко не самое лучшее дополнение эта "Синяя смена". Для мена эталоном качества был и остается Half- life: Oposing Force.
Still an enjoyable and engaging game after all this time.

Короткий, но достойный спин-офф оригинальной Half-Life. Эта часть познакомит нас с офицером охраны Черной Мезы, невольно ставшим свидетелем и участником загадочных и страшных событий конфликта на территории секретного научно-исследовательского центра. Игра открывает для нас еще одного весомого персонажа - высококвалифицированного ученого, появление которого мы еще можем ожидать в будущем уже в третий раз.
Gayet keyifli. Tavsiye ederim!
Fun little mode to the og half life game. fun if you liked half life 1

Bien es cierto que todas las opiniones que he leído de Blue Shift que defienden que "es demasiado corto y que faltan nuevos enemigos y armas" no son para nada desacertadas. Si los vimos en Opposing Force, ¿por qué aquí no? Y si con todo lo que ofreció el primer juego salía un nudo que realmente no daba para más, yo no hubiera descartado artillería ni tipos malos que estaban presentes en éste. Así, tal vez hubiera sido algo más chungo de pasárselo (Blue Shift), independientemente de la dificultad escogida y no hubiera dado tanto la sensación de escasez de contenido.

Sin embargo, pocos son los jugadores que he visto (y no quiero decir que nos los haya) que miren más allá de pegar tiros, cumplir objetivos y resguardar aliados para luego exigir más contenido con tal de prolongar dicha rutina y finalmente decidir si saldría a cuenta rascarse un poco el bolsillo. Creo que no se le da importancia que debería a lo importante que resulta Blue Shift a la hora de hablar de los inicios de Black Mesa como centro de investigación (su punto fuerte por excelencia) y si nos ponemos pragmáticos, a que gracias a él, hemos obtenido importantes actualizaciones gráficas en los tres primeros títulos (sin tener en cuenta Decay, ya que salió exclusiva y oficialmente para PlayStation 2), al ser el que trajo consigo el pack en alta definición. Si hay algo que adoro de los videojuegos, es la oportunidad de investigar sobre todo lo que los envuelve dentro de una crónica y me congratula que Blue Shift no sea una excepción: en varias ocasiones, se encuentra maquinaria inservible de aspecto realmente anticuado o tirada de cualquier manera en los almacenes de las instalaciones y por si esto fuera poco, el desenlace de este juego tiene lugar en unos laboratorios de teletransporte también muy deteriorados por vejez, lo que me induce a interpretarlo como que termina donde empezó absolutamente todo.

Es evidente que Half-Life es mucho más que "toma un arma y que te diviertas", pero por ser un juego que alude a la historia de los laboratorios que marcarían el inicio de un lore tan fascinante con repetida frecuencia, que esconda numerosos Easter Eggs en súmamente pocos capítulos, que el número de hostilidades en cada sección no sea precisamente bajo a proporción de su lacónica duración y obligue al jugador a dosificar la munición por muy debiluchos que X dificultad haga a los enemigos y en el que aparecen rostros familiares como el DR. Freeman, G-Man y Gina Cross, entre muchos otros pros que merece la pena puntualizar que superan en número a sus contras, Half-Life: Blue Shift es mi favorito de toda la serie.

¡RECOMENDADO PARA LOS MÁS DEVOTOS AL MUNDILLO DE HALF-LIFE Y A LOS AMANTES DE LOS SHOOTERS QUE COMPARTAN MI PUNTO DE VISTA SOBRE LO QUE CONOCEMOS POR "JUGAR A UN VIDEOJUEGO"!
great love it

Buena expansión de hl1 donde manejas a un guardia de Black Mesa y tendrás que escapar de los laboratorios infectados de zombies y aliens para poder vivir. Historia que transcurre de manera paralela a la principal que esta bien, pero que no innova en nada, mismas armas, mismos enemigos y mismas localizaciones.

suresome may not like it for vairous reasons but i like the story

If you liked Half-Life, Blue Shift is just ok. This is an add-on that doesn't add anything to the game other than offering another view of the Black Mesa facility. The game is exactly like the main game which is a downside since the weapons and enemies are exactly the same. It's not worth buying separately, but it's worth trying if you get it through a bundle with the main game.

Прошёл [b]Blue Shift[/b], и он - лучше [b]Opposing Force.[/b] Не качеством. Не содержанием. В нём меньше всего и скромнее “отклонения от первоисточника”. Меньше соавторства. Как следствие, он “менее плох”. Говорить же о преимуществах сравнивая его с оригинальной игрой - не приходится. Принципы и отношение [b]Gearbox[/b] к игровому процессу намечаются уже здесь, и резонируют с критикой последующих “самостоятельных” проектов студии.
It is a good expansion pack for the first Half Life game but Opposing Forces is better. 9/10
